result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C Bridges Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony C Bridges in court, in custody, with Attorney Jean Marie La Tour.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #1-3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1-3.  Count #4 is dismissed and read-in, as well as Case #14CM2346, Case #15CM1506, Case #16CM21 and Case #17CM176.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney La Tour makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

180 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Cooperate and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

RESTITUTION:  $602.29 to Kwik Trip on Case #14CM2346 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $343.00 (includes DV surcharge) & $200.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**


COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

180 DAYS HUBER   *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1*

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Cooperate and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 


COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  52 Days (22 days credit),  Non-working hours with standard release conditions  - LAST 30 DAYS STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion 


COUNT #3:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

180 DAYS HUBER   *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1 & 2*

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Cooperate and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 


COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant Anthony C Bridges in court, in custody, with Attorney Jean Marie La Tour.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney La Tour requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns. Attorney La Tour requests bail be modified.  State objects to any bail modification.  Court denies request.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 09:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on February 3, 2017 at 09:30 am.

State objects.  Court denies motion to modify bail.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2017 at 09:30 am.
